docs.snippet: On Wednesday, two Cuban fighter planes fired upon an American shrimp boat in the Florida Straits, in international waters between Cuba and Key West.

docs.snippet: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, Feb. 27--The Government announced tough new measures today designed to end a week-long walkout of electric-power and telephone workers and to halt the threat of further labor trouble.
docs.lead_paragraph: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, Feb. 27--The Government announced tough new measures today designed to end a week-long walkout of electric-power and telephone workers and to halt the threat of further labor trouble.
docs.abstract: Govt announces strict measures to end wk-long power workers walkout; armed forces have taken over plants

headline.main: Uruguay Lists Tough Measures Aimed to Halt Utility Walkout

docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, March 6-- President Kennedy said today that the United States was urging Latin American governments to curb the flow of people of Cuba for training in guerrilla, and subversive activities.

docs.snippet: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, March 8--Uruguay's wool sales have been on a high level for several months, but it is hardly likely that these alone can rectify the country's foreign-trade deficits.
docs.lead_paragraph: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, March 8--Uruguay's wool sales have been on a high level for several months, but it is hardly likely that these alone can rectify the country's foreign-trade deficits.

docs.snippet: BUENOS AIRES, March 15-- Argentina is having hard times. But a man can console himself by sitting down to a huge hunk of beef. Between meals he might have a succulent sausage.
docs.lead_paragraph: BUENOS AIRES, March 15-- Argentina is having hard times. But a man can console himself by sitting down to a huge hunk of beef. Between meals he might have a succulent sausage.

headline.main: Recession on a Meat Diet; Despite Argentine Deficits and Layoffs, A Man Can Buy a Good Steak for 45 Cents

byline.original: By EDWARD C. BURKS Special to The New York Times
